title: Norwich 3-1 West Bromwich Albion: Canaries into FA Cup last 16
description: Norwich City resist a West Bromwich Albion fightback to secure a place in the FA Cup fifth round.
content:
Mohamed Toure continued his stunning start to life on loan at Norwich City as his side secured a 3-1 FA Cup win over West Bromwich Albion.

title: Teenage girl 'loved by all' died after three-car collision
description: Demi Edmunds, 17, from Caldicot, died after a collision involving three cars and a pedestrian.
content:
The family of a 17-year-old girl who died after a crash involving three cars and a pedestrian have described her as "funny, kind and caring" and "loved by all".
Demi Edmunds, from Caldicot, was pronounced dead at the scene after emergency services we... [281 chars]

title: New archbishop of Westminster urges greater understanding of struggles of ‘the vulnerable’
description: At his official installation, Archbishop Richard Moth recognised the Catholic church’s failures but insists it’s a time of ‘opportunity’
content:
The new leader of Roman Catholics in England and Wales has said the church has failed vulnerable people, urging more work to be done to address the struggle of refugees and learn from victims of abuse.

title: FA Cup: Burnley 1-2 Mansfield Town
description: League One side Mansfield Town come from behind to beat Premier League strugglers Burnley and reach the fifth round of the FA Cup for the first time since 1975.
content:
League One side Mansfield Town came from behind to beat Premier League strugglers Burnley and reach the fifth round of the FA Cup for the first time since 1975.

title: Parker sack inevitable after Burnley humiliated yet again ahead of more fan 'temper tantrums'
description: The only argument to keep Scott Parker as Burnley head down is his lower-league record, so being knocked out of both cups by League One sides is sub-optimal
content:
If this is to be Scott Parker’s final game in charge of Burnley, it might be an idea to have someone other than chairman Alan Pace articulate the club’s position.
